summary.para: Gets application-defined data from a device object.

param.name: guid
param.para: The GUID that is associated with the data.

param.name: pDataSize
param.para: A pointer to a variable that on input contains the size, in bytes, of the buffer that pData points to, and on output contains the size, in bytes, of the amount of data that GetPrivateData retrieved.

param.name: pData
param.para: A pointer to a memory block that receives the data from the device object if pDataSize points to a value that specifies a buffer large enough to hold the data.

returns.para: This method returns one of the Direct3D 12 Return Codes.

remarks.para: If the data returned is a pointer to an , or one of its derivative classes, which was previously set by SetPrivateDataInterface, that interface will have its reference count incremented before the private data is returned.

summary.para: Associates a name with the device object. This name is for use in debug diagnostics and tools.

param.name: Name
param.para: A NULL-terminated UNICODE string that contains the name to associate with the device object.

returns.para: This method returns one of the Direct3D 12 Return Codes.

remarks.para: Note that this is simply a convenience wrapper around with WKPDID_D3DDebugObjectNameW. Therefore names which are set with SetName can be retrieved with with the same GUID. Additionally, D3D12 supports narrow strings for names, using the WKPDID_D3DDebugObjectName GUID directly instead.

summary.para: Sets application-defined data to a device object and associates that data with an application-defined GUID.

param.name: guid
param.para: The GUID to associate with the data.

param.name: DataSize
param.para: The size in bytes of the data.

param.name: pData
param.para: A pointer to a memory block that contains the data to be stored with this device object. If pData is NULL, DataSize must also be 0, and any data that was previously associated with the GUID specified in guid will be destroyed.

returns.para: This method returns one of the Direct3D 12 Return Codes.

remarks.para: Rather than using the Direct3D 11 debug object naming scheme of calling ID3D12Object.SetPrivateData using WKPDID_D3DDebugObjectName with an ASCII name, call with a UNICODE name.

summary.para: Associates an -derived interface with the device object and associates that interface with an application-defined GUID.

param.name: guid
param.para: The GUID to associate with the interface.

param.name: pData
param.para: A pointer to the -derived interface to be associated with the device object.

returns.para: This method returns one of the Direct3D 12 Return Codes.

summary.para: An interface from which and inherit from. It provides methods to associate private data and annotate object names.
